text:
Heeeyyy everybody :slightly_smiling_face:
Just joined here.
Is there a way to get the file-id back when uploading stuff via `hs upload` ?

at the moment when I do a `hs upload` i get the following output:
```Uploaded file "/Users/truyvv/projects/TranslationCenter/src/projects/ops-reputation-manager/i18n/locales/de.json" to "/OPS_Translations/ops-reputation-manager/i18n/locales/de.json" ```
What i need now is the Design-Manager-Url of that file(s):
`<https://app.HubSpot.com/design-manager/XXXXXX/file/35745297355>`
The missing part would be the `35745297355`
So is there a way to get this file-Id via CLI ?
If anyone could help us, it would be AWESOME :heart:

Hey <@U01CUEE5P88>, while you can't get the file ID back from the CLI, the design manager does support by-path lookups in the URL with the schema `/<hubID>/code/p/<file path>`, so in your example, you could go to `<https://app.HubSpot.com/design-manager/><HUB ID>/code/p/OPS_Translations/ops-reputation-manager/i18n/locales/de.json`

OMG that would be awesome!!!
Sorry for taking away the hubID: 603347
but it doesnt seem to work:
<https://app.HubSpot.com/design-manager/603347/code/p/OPS_Translations/ops-reputation-manager/i18n/locales/de.json>
If that would work, it would solve my problems.
